Class GameStartSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.GameStartSet

  • public class GameStartSet
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a class that serves a variable controller for the new game to be created.
    Author:
    Jo√£o Vieira, Susana Lima
    See Also:
    Game

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameStartSet(int oc, GuardPersonality gp)
      Creates a GameStartSet with specified ogresCount and guardPersonality, that is not a created level.
      GameStartSet(int w, int h)
      Creates a GameStartSet with specified width and height, being a user created level.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameStartSet

        public GameStartSet(int w,
                    int h)
             throws exception.InvalidBoardSizeException
        Creates a GameStartSet with specified width and height, being a user created level.
        Parameters:
        w - the new value of width
        h - the new value of height
        Throws:
        exception.InvalidBoardSizeException - in case of width and/or height are too big considering previously set parameters.

      • GameStartSet

        public GameStartSet(int oc,
                    GuardPersonality gp)
             throws exception.InvalidOgreCountException
        Creates a GameStartSet with specified ogresCount and guardPersonality, that is not a created level.
        Parameters:
        oc - the new value of ogresCount
        gp - the new value of guardPersonality
        Throws:
        exception.InvalidOgreCountException - when oc is not within predefined limits.
